entry.def: Shàng 上 is a neutral word referring to the submission of anything to someone higher up in the official hierarchy.

sense.def: submit
submit formally (a document); report on
hand up; serve up (food etc)
hand up the contextually determinate thing N2 to N1
rise up into the air
the most important thing
at best, at the most important level
respect as being of superior importance
the front (of an army)
the banks of (a river or lake) 沼上 "beside the pond"
what is of superior quality; what belongs to a higher level
the leadership; those who are of superior rank, those in high social or political positions;
superior to N
the best
of superior or highest quality; of the superior kind; superior; of higher status
at the top; at the higher levels of society; from a superior position; towards the higher levels of society; on a high level of culture
be of the superior kind, be the supremely important thing
cause to be superior> raise to a superior position
be superior to; show oneself being superior to
superior
better one(s)
set up above
of higher quality, of superior quality; best
be best
at best, in the best case

entry.def: Shàng 上(ant. xià 下 "lower") refers to the relatively high position of something, both abstractly and concretely.

sense.def: up to the highest level, to its utmost
highness of musical pitch
high 上天
belonging to a superior or higher sphere of reality; belonging to a higher moral sphere; supreme, uttermost
high [rank]> leading position
operating on a higher metaphysical or moral level

entry.def: Shàng 上 (ant. xià 下 "descend"), on the basis of the general meaning "above", comes to refer to the moving to the position on top of or above something else. [GENERAL]; [[CURRENT]], [[DERIVED]]

sense.def: go up
climb (the contextually determinate place)
go up; move upwards
go up to > embark on > be involved in
go up (to a certain elevated place); climb up (a tree etc.)
directional complement indicating the upwards movement of V 走上
ascend N
move upwards (into the air)
go to the place N
The Sovereign on High 上帝
(abstractly) inside
sky
what is above> sky

entry.def: Shàng 上 is occasionally used to refer to leading position.
Shàng 上 (ant. xià 下 "of lower status") refers occasionally to (comparative) seniority in a hierarchy. [HIGH-DEGREE], [OBJECTIVE], [OFFICIAL], [PUBLIC]

sense.def: leading position, highest leading position; or: person of highest status 無二上
leading position; also nab.t: superior social position, higher social position
noble, distinguished 上客
those of high status
treat as most noble> yield the highest position to

entry.def: The standard word referring to what is above or on top is shàng 上. >>SPATIAL!, CONCRETE!

sense.def: in the leading position in respect to the contextually determinate N
in the leading position in respect to N
above the contextually determinate N
above
a place above (a river etc) 濮水之上, a place higher than; a place on high
the upper side of; upon, on 泰山之上
upper; being situated above/upstairs
(Heaven) above (Note that there is no Heaven below or anywhere else.)
above (in the text) > the above mentioned/described
above (in the text)
on top
above of N > related to N
on something; on the top of something; in (an elevated place) (e.g. 堂上 (not: on the roof!)
Christian Chinese: superior, belonging to a higher order of things
the position above the contextually determinate other thing N
the leading position (above all)
before N, at N and before
what is above
to the upper side, to the better side
Han court language: the Emperor

entry.def: Shàng 上 can refer to any governing authority or ruler, but by Han times the word became a standard polite way of referring to the Han emperor.

sense.def: ruler; superiors
[our] ruler; or: one's ruler(a number of examples must be moved here.
the leadership, the authorities; one's ruler, the ruler; superiors; persons in high position
the rulership; HAN DYNASTY: the Emperor
leader of, senior person among
Heaven
on N (mountain etc)
e.g. 廟堂之上 "up in the temple": on; up in
on (like "apply on" – not in the concrete spatial sense)
in antiquity

entry.def: Shàng 上 (ant. xià 下 "despise, have no special respect for") refer to giving high practical priority to something out of a sense of admiration or appreciation. [ASCENDING], [OBJ=NON-HU], [OBJECTIVE], [OVERT], [PUBLIC]

sense.def: REGARD AS ELEVATED loan for shàng 尚> put high or highest in one's intellectual hierarchy, exalt, value highly
on the one hand (上 ...下 ... on the one hand... on the other hand)
on the one hand (上則 ...下則 ... "on the one hand... on the other hand" - SHANG and XIA preceding another adverb): SHOULD BE CODED AS vad.padV:adS
on the one hand (上 ...下 ... on the one hand... on the other hand)
give priority to; set highest
high 上古 "high antiquity" 上世 [note the connotation of elevated significance of high antiquity]
